addressleaf.section: A Monsieur Monsieur de Sidney Chevelier et Governeur de la Ville de Vlissingnes.

page.lettertext:
fol.170r
S
r
Thomas Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
I assure yo
r
L. I knowe not what to
make of
at siege of
e towne of
Ostend.
For me thinkes
at garrison is more trobled
w
t
a siege in report, then some other would
be troubled w
t
a siege in action. We shall
see by this winde, w
at
answear will be made
to
at letter of
e
Councel,
w
ch
was sent unto
her
Ma
tie
.
To yo
r
L. letter, w
t
e booke
of Barowe, for w
ch
I thanke yo
w
very
hartely, I sent a present answear
e next
d a y after: w
ch
I can not nowe remember
to whome I delivered, nor w
at
other mater
it contened. And though I thinke there
were nothing, that could turne me to anger,
yet in truth I am angrie,
at any letter should
miscarie. O
r
Councel of state is
removed to
Utrecht,
and will reside
ether there, or in some other place, that is
neere to
e campe: where I purpose to
goe after, but
at I looke by this winde
for some letter from home, w
ch
I would
willingly receave before I goe from
e Hage.
Since
e taking of
Zutphen
sconce, I knowe
not w
at
action is undertaken of
e campe
For in
e absence of
e Councell o
r
intelli-
gence heere is exceeding slender. Howbeit
it is given out, that they are busily occupied
about
e planting of artillerie before
e
towne it self of Zutphen. As any certaintie
cometh of any mater of worthe, I
will advertise yo
r
L. w
t
e spediest op-
portunitie: w
ch
I would not have omitted
for a weeke or two past, but
at I made
fol.170v
full account,
at yo
r
L. was departed
and would before this have bin at
e c
a
pe.
The
Germany
Levie goeth forward very
slowely. For I am newly nowe advertised
from
S
r
Horace Pallavicine
, that they will
not be ready to come forward till
e 12
of July. Their nombers will be suche,
as were demaunded at
e first: 6000
horse and 9000 foote, 1200 pioners, &
Canons, and 12 feeld peeces. W
ch
way
they shall passe it is
not
yet resolved.
And
so I cease not at this present from trou-
bling yo
r
L. till other mater be offered,
Fr
o
e Hage. May 20 1591.
Yo
r
L. Wholy and at commaundm
t
Tho. Bodley
